plugins.name: Angle Mockups
plugins.description:
Apply your screen designs to perspective mockups. The plugin is free and does not require an account. If you wish to use our huge library of 1000+ mockups in full vector, check out https://Angle.sh


For this plugin to work, you will need to create a Screen vector shape where you want to apply your app design. This can be drawn with the Pen tool (P) with 4 corners in this specific order: top left, top right, bottom right, bottom left and back to top left.


For more instructions, please check this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vtN1eQI27Fw


It is recommended to use our free sample mockups where the Mockups are already drawn for you. If you have any question, please contact us.

plugins.name: Chart
plugins.description:
Chart is the most powerful plugin for Figma, FigJam and Slides that uses real or random data to create 18 types of charts. Chart supports copy-paste from editors like Excel, Numbers, Google Sheets, live connection with Google Sheets and remote JSON (REST API), local CSV and JSON files.


Key features:

— 19 types of charts out-of-the-box

— generate random data with different trends

— import data from CSV, JSON, Google Sheets, REST APIs, type to table input or just paste from table processors like Excel

— customize charts with different options

— edit and update charts

----------

Helpful links:

  1. Official website: https://chartplugin.com
  2. How to activate PRO or TEAM tier
  3. Overview of Chart's features
  4. Integration with Google Sheets and other table data
  5. Style Templates
  6. Use Chart with Components and Auto layout in Figma

----------

Customer support: hello@chartplugin.com

----------

Working with text and image data a lot? Check our second plugin DataLab: https://datalab-plugin.com/

plugins.name: Pitchdeck Presentation Studio
plugins.description:
Documentation & Video Tutorials


For plugin documentation and step by step video tutorials, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/pitchdeck


Questions & Support


Pitchdeck is still a baby panda, so if you notice any bugs or have any questions about the plugin, please get in touch directly via https://hypermatic.com/contact and we'll help you troubleshoot and resolve them as quickly as possible.


Security


Pitchdeck is designed to be privacy and security focused — for details about security and how the plugin works, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/pitchdeck/security


Features


  1. Super easy animations and real-time previews inside Figma.
  2. Export slides to an interactive shareable URL to present in the browser.
  3. Export files for PowerPoint/Keynote/Google Slides, with editable text.
  4. Export to a PDF file (with optional password protection).
  5. Import slides from PowerPoint, Google Slides or Keynote (as exported .pptx files) into Figma automatically (BETA)
  6. Add GIFs and YouTube/Vimeo/MP4 video embeds to layers in your slides.
  7. Built-in presentation analytics data and custom share link URLs.
  8. Embed content from Figma, Loom, Canva, Lottie, Google Docs/Sheets/Slides, SoundCloud or Spotify.
  9. Add slide links or website URL links to layers in your slides.
  10. Built-in GIPHY and Pixabay search integrations.
  11. Quickly re-order slides by visual position, Figma layer order or drag and drop.
  12. Automatically generate Charts by adding your own CSV data.
  13. Optional automatic page numbering Figma component for your slides.
  14. Set approval workflow statuses to keep track of which slides are ready.
  15. Automatically generates password protected presentation URLs.
  16. Simple, seamless and easy to use presentations in the browser.
  17. Includes speaker notes, timer, laser pointer, and slide controls.
  18. Control your presentation from your phone/tablet by scanning a QR code.
  19. Present in fullscreen with notes and controls on a second screen.
  20. Spell check your Figma slides in dozens of languages.
  21. The Pitchdeck plugin can be run in both Figma Design files and Figma Slides files.


Creating presentations has never been so easy (and cool).

Everything you need for a great presentation — from animations and to GIFs/videos, to slide notes and lasers, to exporting for PowerPoint/Keynote/Google Slides/PDF.


The simplest presentation interface you've ever used.

Add smooth animations to your any of your Figma slide layers with real-time, directly inside Figma using the Pitchdeck timeline. Select from dozens of premium presets, or craft your own custom animations.


Embed GIFs, videos and iFrames to slide layers.

Simply paste a URL into Pitchdeck to embed GIFs, videos (.mp4, YouTube, Vimeo) and clickable links on any layer. You can also embed content from Figma, Canva, Loom, Lottie, Google Docs/Sheets/Slides, SoundCloud and Spotify.


Simple, password protected slide decks in the browser.

Create a password protected URL for your Figma slides to give a presentation from anywhere. You'll get everything you need to present your Figma slides from a browser window.


Showcase longer pages or website mockups with scrollable slides.

Whether you're presenting website designs to a client, or a portfolio piece in a job interview — Pitchdeck automatically handles longer Figma slides.


Built-in analytics with custom share links.

See how your deck is performing at a high-level and and per-session; create custom URLs for different stakeholders to easily filter your metrics by specific viewers — all instantly exportable to a CSV file.


Export from Figma to PowerPoint, Keynote or Google Slides.

Pitchdeck can also export your Figma slides to files that you can open with Microsoft PowerPoint, Google Slides and Apple Keynote with editable text, or easily share the file via email and Slack.


Export your slides from Figma to PDF.

Export your Figma slides to a single PDF deck in seconds, perfect for quickly sharing via email or Slack. Add optional password protection for securely sending confidential Figma slide decks under NDA.


Import slides from PowerPoint into Figma with one click.

If you already have a presentation designed in PowerPoint, you can automatically import the slides from your .pptx file as editable Figma layers with one click. Please note, this feature is still in BETA.


Pitchdeck Pro


10 free trials of Pitchdeck Pro are included with the free version, and if you're a casual user, you can continue using the free version of Pitchdeck forever.


If you're a power user, you can optionally upgrade to continue using all the extra features that are only available in the pro version of Pitchdeck.


To learn more about Pitchdeck Pro, please visit https://www.hypermatic.com/pitchdeck/#pro

accepted.name: Hypermatic
accepted.description: Never send a human to do a machine's job. Spend less time crying, and more time designing.

plugins.tagline: Turn your Figma designs into animated slide decks or export them to PowerPoint/PDF

networkAccess.reasoning: Pitchdeck queries hypermatic.com to validate licenses for Pro users and load assets to speed up plugin loading times. Pitchdeck also queries googleapis.com to upload your slides from Figma if the Pitchdeck Web URL export format is selected. Pitchdeck requires all domains to be accessible from the plugin due to supporting iFrame embeds within your slides to display your own websites or embed media from other sites (eg. youtube.com, vimeo.com, figma.com, canva.com etc).

plugins.name: Brandfetch
plugins.description:
Brands at your fingertips ✨ Say goodbye to searching for the latest brand asset — Brandfetch gives you instant access to millions of logos, colors, fonts and more so you can streamline your designs. Make sure your brand is on-brand and easily accessible by adding it to Brandfetch, the global brand platform.


Key Features


  1. Import brand assets from millions of brands directly on Figma.
  2. Access the latest logos, icons, colors, fonts and more.
  3. Claim your brand and sync your assets to Brandfetch for easy-access.


About Brandfetch


Brandfetch is the global brand platform, hosting the world’s brands. Search from the largest and most up-to-date brand asset repository and add your brand to keep it consistent across the internet.


For any questions or feedback, contact support@brandfetch.io

plugins.name: Material Theme Builder
plugins.description:
Type theming is here!

Now you can customize your fonts along with color.


* Playground file added with instructions and color schematic! Try it out by clicking Open In… + Playground file*


The Material Theme builder is built to assist in exploring the possibilities of dynamic color, harmonizing brand colors, and customizing a type scale. All with implementation in mind to bridge designer and developer workflows.


⚠ Surfaces 1–5 will remain in the builder for current users, but we recommend migrating to new surface tokens as soon as possible. Fixed accents add a new set of colors that will remain consistent across light and dark themes.⚠


File Bugs Here:

https://github.com/material-foundation/material-theme-builder/issues/new/


How to use:

Setup and explore color

  1. Run by searching for Material Theme Builder within Figma plugin search and click Run or Open in… from the Community page. + Playground File will add a playground file within your drafts.
  2. With the plugin open click Create Theme to generate a theme (material-theme) and Material Design tokens as Figma styles.
  3. Using design kit components? Turn on State Layers within settings, this will generate needed state layers when customizing the theme.
  4. Assign MD tokens (Figma styles) to custom elements and components, then swap to the currently selected theme.
  5. Select elements that have styles assigned and Swap to update the theme used in the components.


Create a custom theme

Your brand’s colors can still take advantage of the Material You color story without dynamic color controlling the UI with the help of some resources. Colors will be shifted to generate accessible colors within the same color space as dynamic colors.


Extended Colors

  1. To extend past user-generated dynamic colors or add semantic colors. Click Add a color. A color input will appear and update the color schematic. 
  2. Click on the color input to prompt a color picker to update the color. 
  3. To rename a custom color, update the name within the text input and click outside the input when done.
  4. Delete by clicking on the trash can icon.


Add theme and presets

You can change the current theme, add a new theme, and reset the current theme within the Theme menu (dropdown at top). 


Selecting a different theme changes the current theme to edit. Swap will update whatever is selected to the current theme in the dropdown. 


Presets are available in the menu to reset the current theme back to the Material baseline theme. 


Type theme

Font family can now be customized from the plugin.

  1. Select the Type tab icon in the tab bar.
  2. Select the Display, Headlines, & Titles dropdown. You are able to search and select a Google Font to customize the display, headline, and title categories.
  3. Select the Body & Labels dropdown. You are able to search and select a Google Font to customize the body and label categories.


Export

Ready to implement your theme? Click Export and select your desired code format. 

Learn about themes and migrating to M3 or try out implementation with Adding dynamic color to your app codelab and Customizing Material color lab. 


Learn more about the Material Theme Builder material.io/material-theme-builder

Suggestions or feedback? Ping us @materialdesign on Twitter.

accepted.name: Material Design
accepted.description: Material is an adaptable design system—backed by open-source code—that helps teams easily build high-quality digital experiences.

plugins.tagline: Generate beautiful dynamic color and custom themes for material 3.

plugins.name: Streamline Icons, Illustrations, and Emoji. A UI/UX icon library with svg and png.
plugins.description:
Streamline won the Best Graphic Resource award by Figma in 2022 🏆



About Streamline

Founded 12 years ago, Streamline is the only icon system for harmonious designs and faster workflow. Discover our 200,000 icon system, meticulously designed with a consistent style by our team of eight icon designers.



Consistent and massive sets

Streamline sets are 50 times larger than the industry average. Our largest set, Ultimate Bold, has over 18000 icons. Learn how we craft our sets here.



Testimonials from the world's best designers

Streamline is enthusiastically recommended by the world's best creators, designers and companies.

  1. Tobias Van Schneider‍: The only icon set I've ever used. And the only one I will ever use. No regrets and not even worth looking at other ones.
  2. Figma: Our friends at Streamline just added new icons to their already massive collection, and we're obsessed.
  3. Brett at Design Joy: I use these icons for virtually every project. It's been a lifesaver. Never search for an icon again. You're welcome.
  4. Khoi Vinh, Senior Director of Product Design at Adobe: I own several icon sets but the one that I return to over and over is the copious Streamline pack, which almost always seems to have just the pictogram I need when I dig into its catalog.
  5. View all testimonials


License

  1. Open-source sets are licensed under Creative Commons by 4.0. Please link to streamlinehq.com when you use them.
  2. Free sets require attribution. Please link to streamlinehq.com when you use them.
  3. Paid subscribers can use these for unlimited personal and commercial projects without attribution.
  4. To use more than 100+ icons/50 illustrations in a single project, please contact us.
  5. View full license terms: free and premium



FAQs

  1. How do I outline icons? Use our web app or desktop app to outline icons.
  2. What is available for free? Over 13,000 vector icons, illustrations, elements and emoji are available for free with attribution. Our largest free icon set has 4,000 icons. You might also like Pixel icons, Memes, and Plump icons.
  3. Can I try premium icons? Yes, most of our pro sets have free versions. Use the free filter on the web or the figma plugin. No card required!
  4. I have another question! Contact our support via the chat widget on our website.



Pricing

You can continue to use our free vector sets via the plugin as long as you'd like. All our features, desktop app, web app, and extensions are free to use. You can upgrade to a premium plan for more assets and our larger sets. There are two ways to purchase:

  1. Subscription: Pricing starts at $19/month for a subscription.
  2. One-time purchase: You can purchase individual sets and get access to plugins, web app and desktop app.



Get inspired

  1. Interface Design
  2. Graphic Design
  3. Presentations
  4. Product Design
  5. Diagramming and Flowcharts
  6. Content Marketing
  7. Signage and Wayfinding



Happy Streamlinin'

Vincent

@streamlinehq

plugins.name: Jitter · Animation for Figma
plugins.description:
Jitter is a fast and simple animation tool on the web:

  1. ✨ Animate all your interfaces (mobile apps, websites, landing pages, micro-interactions…) and content (social media, videos, ads…)
  2. 🎬 Export as a video, GIF, or Lottie
  3. 📐 Create your motion design system
  4. 🤖 Hand off the animation specs to the developers
  5. 🤝 Hand off your animated templates to the marketing team

It’s like Figma, but for motion design. 💫



How to use the plugin


  1. Select a frame or layer in Figma, and click the “Copy” button on the plugin
  2. Open a new Jitter file and hit ⌘V to paste
  3. Animate ✨


Pro tip: Hit ⇧⌘V to update a layer in Jitter (use shift + ctrl + V on Windows): we’ll sync your changes from Figma and keep your animations in place.



Features


Pixel-perfect import

Import your designs in Jitter in 1 click: they look exactly like Figma. It feels like magic. ✨


Text animations

Animate the letters, words and lines of your titles and texts super easily.


Animation presets

Explore ideas faster with animation presets: add presets to your layers in one click, customize everything afterwards.


Customize everything

We give you full design control over the animation parameters. Your imagination is the limit.


Export to video, GIF and Lottie

Export your animated designs as videos (up to 4K and 60 fps in the .mp4, .mov and .webm formats), GIF, and Lottie. You can even export videos and GIFs with a transparent background.


Handoff your animation parameters to developers

Share your file URL with the developers so that they can inspect the animation parameters: they will get all the information they need to recreate your animations autonomously.



FAQ


What can I do with the plugin?

You can import your Figma files into Jitter, and animate them easily. To do so:


1. Select a frame or layer in Figma and click the “Copy” button on the plugin

2. From there, you can:

  1. Create a new Jitter file → Click the “Open in Jitter” button in the plugin
  2. Paste in Jitter → Open a Jitter file and hit ⌘V (use ctrl + V on Windows)
  3. Sync your changes from Figma → In Jitter, select your layer and hit ⇧⌘V (use shift + ctrl + V on Windows): we’ll update it with the latest changes from Figma, and keep your animations in place

3. Animate ✨


What kind of animations can I do with Jitter?

You can animate anything with Jitter: whether you are designing an interface, an app, a website, an illustration, a presentation video, a social media post, an Instagram story, a YouTube intro, or anything else, you can import your design into Jitter in 1 click and animate right away. We are a design tool like Figma, so we give you total control over the parameters: your imagination is the limit.


Can I export to Lottie?

Yes, Jitter actually the best workflow to do that today: you can import your Figma designs in 1 click with this plugin, add your animations in Jitter, and export to the Lottie format. Then you can include your Lottie animations to your apps, websites, Webflow projects, LottieFiles workspace, or anything else.


Can I design micro-interactions?

Yes, you can animate all the basic properties of your layers, groups, and masks: position, size, rotation, scale, opacity, corner radius, shadow, stroke…


How are you different from other plugins?

We use a unique way to make animations: After Effects and most animations plugins (e.g. Motion, Figmotion, Aninix, SVG Motion, Bannerify and the other Figmatic plugins…) use the traditional keyframe system, which is complex to use.


Instead, we use an animation model where we give instructions to the layers (like “Slide in”, “Fade out”…): building an animation is more intuitive, and the timeline is easy to read.


In fact, creating animations in Jitter is as simple as building an animation in PowerPoint or Keynote, but you have total control over the parameters: Jitter is a modern alternative to After Effects, with no learning curve. It's fast, simple, and collaborative.


I found a bug, what should I do?

If you encounter any bugs, please reach out to us at support@jitter.video and we'll be able to fix it rapidly! ⚡️



Known limitations


Our priority is to make a pixel-perfect import. We support most Figma properties natively in Jitter. For layers with unsupported properties, we convert them to PNG or SVG so that you always get a pixel-perfect version in Jitter.


A layer will be exported as a PNG or SVG if it has one of these properties:

  1. Rich text (different colors or font weights in the same text layer)
  2. Variable font
  3. Independent corner radius
  4. Gradient fill on text layers
  5. Multiple fills
  6. Gradient stroke
  7. Individual stroke
  8. Multiple strokes
  9. Multiple shadows


Here are the other known limitations:

  1. You can only export 1 frame or layer at a time
  2. Blend modes are not supported in Jitter
  3. Only simple masks are supported in Jitter (when the masking layer is the last layer of the group) – in all other cases, mask groups are exported as images



Contact


If you want to share your feedback, please reach out to us at support@jitter.video.


📸 Instagram · 🎬 YouTube · 🐤 Twitter · 🧑‍💼 LinkedIn

How to Get Remove Background from Image with 3 Steps?

2. Select one picture and run the Background Remover from the Plugins menu.

3. Get your image without background, but with the original image size and quality.

  

Meet the Best Online Image Editor – Wondershare PixCut 


PixCut is a multi-purpose image tool developed by Wondershare Technology to help you do all kinds of alterations to your image. People can use PixCut to design posters, banners, YouTube thumbnails, Instagram posts, and many more for marketing, career, or other related purposes. 


What Makes PixCut the Best Online Editing Tool?

You don't have to outline the background to be removed manually. The automatic removal of the background does not take more than a few seconds to complete.

The supported environments are URL, Node.js, Python, Java, PHP, Objective-C, and .Net. You can get a successful API call for one credit.

With one simple click, all the displeasing scratches, defects, and watermarks from your image will disappear into thin air. 


4. Online Bulk Remove 

Need to remove the backgrounds of multiple images? You can remove the backgrounds of up to 30 images, all at once.

You can enlarge your image to 4 times while still keeping the high resolution intact.

plugins.name: TeleportHQ - Figma to Code - Export HTML, CSS, React & Vue
plugins.description:
Export your Figma prototype to HTML/CSS, React, Next, Vue, Nuxt and Angular


Export your components and design system to teleportHQ, integrate the generated code into your web application codebase and publish your website with one click.


How to use the plugin?

  1. Select any layers from your high fidelity prototypes, export them to teleportHQ and get the code with one click
  2. Use the “Copy to Clipboard” functionality to copy and paste the layers into your existing teleportHQ project


Learn more about how to use this plugin here.


Code Export

Export your code to React, Next, Vue, Nuxt, Angular and HTML/CSS


Make responsive adjustments, test everything in TeleportHQ and publish with one click.


Developer handoff has never been easier!


Open Source Code Generators

TeleportHQ's code generators are open source. If you don't find exactly what you need you can build your own. We'll support you!


Want to learn more? Check out the REPL where you can test the code generators with all the js frameworks or css-in-js libraries.


Limitations

The current version of the TeleportHQ design to code plugin does not yet support


  1. Masks
  2. Background blur and layer blur
  3. Scales & rotations
  4. Radial gradients
  5. Shadow tokens
  6. Component overrides and variants
  7. GIFs
  8. Rich-text elements


About Us

TeleportHQ is a low-code platform and a suite of open-source tools that focus on the designer-developer handoff and the visual building of user interfaces.


Follow Us

Twitter - Facebook - LinkedIn


Support/Community

Need help? Join us on our Discord community and discuss with one of our team members.

plugins.name: Figma to Webflow (HTML, CSS and Website)
plugins.description:
About


Export Figma to HTML and CSS with Webflow


Transform your static designs into a production-ready site with Webflow. Sync your design system — components, variables, and styles — to give your team the power to launch sophisticated sites quickly.


Getting started


1. Install and connect

- Install the Figma to Webflow plugin

- Authorize your Webflow Workspaces or sites


2. Sync layers, variables, or styles

- Export Figma layers to Webflow components and elements

- Export Figma variables to Webflow variables

- Export Figma text and effect styles to Webflow classes

- Copy/paste Figma layers as elements in Webflow


3. Import in Webflow

- Click "Continue in Webflow" or open your site

- Open the Figma to Webflow app (installed automatically)

- Import your layers, variables, or styles


4. Polish and publish

- Bring your static designs to life with Webflow Interactions

- Connect to Webflow's visual-first, composable CMS

- Generate new page sections that match your designs using AI Assistant

- Leverage built-in tools for analytics, A/B testing, personalization, and SEO


Learn more about Figma to Webflow


Webflow Labs Terms of Service and Privacy Policy

plugins.name: Motion - Animation for Figma
plugins.description:
Motion is the ultimate animation tool for Figma

🎬 Animate mobile apps, websites, landing pages, micro-interations

🎬 Animate social media, videos, ads

😊 Work on your canvas in Figma in real-time (no need to switch to another window)

📂 Export as Video, GIF, APNG, SVG, and more

🤝 Share animations with your team

🧑‍🚀 Support available 24/7


More than 300,000 users already us it! 🎉

Join us!



💡 How to use it


There are three ways to animate, and you can mix them however you like!


1. Automatic recording of all canvas changes

Turn on the "Record" button in Motion and follow the instructions.


2. Using animation presets

Select a layer, and the presets panel will appear in Motion. Choose any preset you like.


3. Manual animation

Use keyframes, paths, and links for advanced animations.


Check our documentation for more details.



📖 Documentation


Quick Start Guide

Animation Examples



🔦 Features


For Beginners and Professionals

Whether you're a beginner or a professional, Motion is a powerful and easy-to-use tool. It offers various animation tools, allowing you to choose the one that suits your needs for any type of animation.


Automatic Recording

Record your animation with just a few clicks. Turn on the option, make changes on the canvas, move the time handle forward, make more changes, and click play to see the result.


Animation presets

Choose from nearly 100 ready-made animation presets for quick and easy motion effects.


Keyframes

Animate almost any layer property with precise keyframe control.


Paths

Move objects along a custom path for smooth animations.


Links

Create advanced animations with depenedent objects.


Export to Multiple Formats

Save your animations as GIF, Video, APNG, SVG, and more.


Team Collaboration

Share your Figma file with edit permissions to let your team view and play animations.



🙋‍♂️ FAQ


What can I animate with Motion?

The short answer is literally everything. There are no limits. You can animate interfaces, apps, websites, landing pages, promo videos, games, social media, micro-interactions, ads, Instagram stories, and YouTube shorts. The possibilities are endless!


Why Motion and not other tools?

Motion is one of the most powerful animation tools for Figma. Plus, you never have to leave Figma—no switching windows or syncing with external apps. It's seamless and efficient!


What is Automatic Recording?

Create animations just like designing! Move the time handle, make changes in Figma, and repeat. Motion records everything—just hit Play when you're done!


Which export formats does Motion support?

  1. GIF – Great for short, looping animations.
  2. Video (MP4/WebM) – High quality, small file size, ideal for social media.
  3. APNG – Animated PNG with full transparency.
  4. Animated SVG – Best for web animations.
  5. CSS – Lightweight animations for websites.
  6. JSON – Perfect for developers.
  7. PNG Sprite – A sequence of frames in one file.
  8. PNG Frames – Individual frames for custom use.


How do I share animations with my team?

Anyone with edit access to your file can view and modify animations. To prevent changes, you can lock animations for other users.


What should I do if I have a problem?

You can always reach out via email or any of our social media channels. We strive to assist our users 24/7.



🌍 Contact


You can always reach out to us at figmamotionpugin@gmail.com.

133221.name: Motion - Animation for Figma
133221.description:
Motion is the ultimate animation tool for Figma

🎬 Animate mobile apps, websites, landing pages, micro-interations

🎬 Animate social media, videos, ads

😊 Work on your canvas in Figma in real-time (no need to switch to another window)

📂 Export as Video, GIF, APNG, SVG, and more

🤝 Share animations with your team

🧑‍🚀 Support available 24/7


More than 300,000 users already us it! 🎉

Join us!



💡 How to use it


There are three ways to animate, and you can mix them however you like!


1. Automatic recording of all canvas changes

Turn on the "Record" button in Motion and follow the instructions.


2. Using animation presets

Select a layer, and the presets panel will appear in Motion. Choose any preset you like.


3. Manual animation

Use keyframes, paths, and links for advanced animations.


Check our documentation for more details.



📖 Documentation


Quick Start Guide

Animation Examples



🔦 Features


For Beginners and Professionals

Whether you're a beginner or a professional, Motion is a powerful and easy-to-use tool. It offers various animation tools, allowing you to choose the one that suits your needs for any type of animation.


Automatic Recording

Record your animation with just a few clicks. Turn on the option, make changes on the canvas, move the time handle forward, make more changes, and click play to see the result.


Animation presets

Choose from nearly 100 ready-made animation presets for quick and easy motion effects.


Keyframes

Animate almost any layer property with precise keyframe control.


Paths

Move objects along a custom path for smooth animations.


Links

Create advanced animations with depenedent objects.


Export to Multiple Formats

Save your animations as GIF, Video, APNG, SVG, and more.


Team Collaboration

Share your Figma file with edit permissions to let your team view and play animations.



🙋‍♂️ FAQ


What can I animate with Motion?

The short answer is literally everything. There are no limits. You can animate interfaces, apps, websites, landing pages, promo videos, games, social media, micro-interactions, ads, Instagram stories, and YouTube shorts. The possibilities are endless!


Why Motion and not other tools?

Motion is one of the most powerful animation tools for Figma. Plus, you never have to leave Figma—no switching windows or syncing with external apps. It's seamless and efficient!


What is Automatic Recording?

Create animations just like designing! Move the time handle, make changes in Figma, and repeat. Motion records everything—just hit Play when you're done!

How do I share animations with my team?

Anyone with edit access to your file can view and modify animations. To prevent changes, you can lock animations for other users.


What should I do if I have a problem?

You can always reach out via email or any of our social media channels. We strive to assist our users 24/7.

plugins.name: Storyset by Freepik
plugins.description:
50,000+ Customizable Illustrations from Freepik, free to use!


Storyset by Freepik, gives you access to 50,000+ customizable illustrations for your Figma designs. With Storyset by Freepik, you can search through all these illustrations, choose from 5 unique styles, change the color of illustrations, and one-click insert them.


What illustration styles can I choose from?

There are currently 5 unique illustration styles. There’s Rafiki, which is a range of blues that are calming yet bright. There’s Bro, which is a palette of greens to grab your attention. There’s Amico, which focuses on purples, to ground you. There’s Pana, with subtle reds and oranges to grab your attention. And finally, there’s Cuate, which emphasizes yellows and oranges, to bring your graphics to life.


Which topics or categories are included in this free plugin?

You’ll be able to find illustrations from the following categories in this plugin:

  • Business and work illustrations
  • Education illustrations
  • Medical illustrations
  • People illustrations
  • Technology illustrations
  • Restaurant and food illustrations
  • Plant and home illustrations


What can I do with each illustration?

Each illustration can have its foreground and background colors changed. Additionally, each illustration can have its background removed or hidden (this means that in your website, marketing or app design, you can choose how much each illustration stands out).


How do I use this plugin?

Click the "Open in..." button on this page. Then, when your Figma document is ready, click the "Run" button. From there, the Storyset by Freepik plugin will be ready to use.


Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ):

  • Does this Figma Plugin cost anything? This plugin is free. All features within it are available for all users.
  • How can I share feedback with you? We’d love to hear what could be improved. To do so, please leave us some feedback here: integrations@freepik.com
  • How do I access all of Freepik’s 100 million assets? The fastest way is to visit freepik.com.
  • Does Freepik offer any other plugins? We currently have 4 plugins that are free to use, and we'll be launching more in the coming months. You can find them all here: https://www.figma.com/@freepik


Having some trouble?

Please contact us as integrations@freepik.com with any questions, feedback or concerns you have.

accepted.description: Graphic resources and AI tools to speed up your creative workflow.

plugins.name: Figma to Fully Responsive HTML & Clean Code 20x Faster with AI - pxCode
plugins.description:
🚀 Easily convert your design into Fully Responsive HTML CSS / React / Vue / Tailwind


Over 240,000 people have downloaded pxCode!


No auto layout required!


Got brand new website UI designs in Figma? Convert them into fully responsive, pixel perfect, developer-friendly clean code including HTML / React / Vue / Tailwind with our Figma to HTML tool.


Unlike most tools, pxCode exports your code seamlessly and doesn’t require you to use Figma’s auto layout with your designs. You also get developer-friendly and clean code that’s easy to integrate.


Why pxCode?

  1. Design to code
  2. Generates Fully Responsive web pages with AI
  3. No auto layout required
  4. Complete control over your HTML and code
  5. Exported code is immediately ready for integration
  6. No code dependencies


pxCode is a Design to Code tool. You have complete control to make flexible edits on your design and export developer-friendly HTML / CSS / React.js / Vue / Tailwind CSS code for integration.


Try the pxCode plugin on this design.


How to use:

  1. Install the pxCode Figma plugin
  2. Export your Figma design through the pxCode plugin
  3. Import your Figma design file into pxCode through your web browser
  4. Edit your design without any artificial limitations
  5. Edit Responsive Webpages with CSS Media Query
  6. Preview your design as a responsive webpage
  7. Export developer-friendly code


Try pxCode at:

pxCode 👈


Blog:

pxCode Blog 👈

plugins.name: Flaticon by Freepik
plugins.description:
5,000,000+ Icons, Stickers, Shapes and Vectors from Freepik!


Flaticon by Freepik is the quickest way to access 5,000,000+ pixel-perfect icons, stickers, shapes and vectors. These will instantly enhance your Figma designs.


What can I do with this plugin?

With Flaticon by Freepik, you can search for icons using any term, filter by type (e.g. outline, fill, color, etc), filter by style (e.g. color, black, gradient), and insert the icon as a component.


Even more, you can browse by a specific icon pack or set. This makes it super easy to stay on-brand when you’re using multiple icons.


What icon and vector types are available?

There are 4 unique types available: outlined icons, filled icons, lineal color icons and hand-drawn icons. Any of these can be used with this free plugin.


What colors are available?

With this free plugin, you can find 3 different color types: color icons, black icons and gradient icons. These can all be used without limitation.


How do I use this plugin?

Click the "Open in..." button on this page. Then, when your Figma document is ready, click the "Run" button. From there, the Flaticon by Freepik plugin will be ready to use.


Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ):

  1. Does this Figma Plugin cost anything? To try out this plugin, it’s 100% free. If you’d like full access to all SVGs, then you’ll want to consider upgrading here: https://www.flaticon.com/profile/my_subscriptions
  2. How can I share feedback with you? We’d love to hear what could be improved. To do so, please leave us some feedback here: https://freepikcompany.typeform.com/to/rfUzOJ4y

plugins.name: MockRocket – 3D Mockups
plugins.description:
Create stunning 3D device mockups in 2 clicks.


Featuring clay devices, shadows, custom colors, reflections, and transparent backgrounds. Choose from the latest 3D device models – iPhone, MacBook, iMac and more. Simply drag to rotate the device in true 3D. Export to Figma seconds later.


Getting started:

  1. Install and run the plugin from the plugin menu
  2. Choose a device
  3. Select an appropriately sized frame in Figma. You can also click "Draw guide frame" to get a perfectly sized frame to use–resize your designs to fit the frame and then select it
  4. Click "Load selection" to load your selected frame into the plugin.
  5. Drag the mockup to rotate it in 3D, or choose a preset position.
  6. Change settings–toggle shadows and reflections, device colors, and clay mode.
  7. Click "Export to Figma" (at 1x to 4x resolution) or "Download" to save to your device


Powered by MockRocket.io – the easiest platform for creating stunning 3D device mockups and animated product videos. Start for free today: MockRocket.io


License

You can export up to 10 mockups totally free, then you will be prompted to purchase a license key. License keys are included with all paid plans on MockRocket.io


Pricing: https://mockrocket.io/pricing


Support: derek@mockrocket.io

plugins.name: Mesh Gradient
plugins.description:
Free yourself from the constraints of linear & radial gradients.


Mesh Gradient generates a gradient image with an underlying 2d mesh, and lets you edit the vertices & edges of the mesh to get the perfect gradient look.


Achieving something similar with existing gradients would be impossible, since layering numerous gradients results in muddied colors and sub-par results.


Features:

  1. Live preview in plugin
  2. Save gradients and load them later to edit
  3. Render high-definition gradient images


Features in development:

  1. Color eyedrop tool
  2. Performance improvements


Bugs, questions, or feedback? --> https://twitter.com/GuamHat

plugins.name: A11y - Color Contrast Checker
plugins.description:
Ensure your text is readable for users by adhering to WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) standards.


This plugin checks the color contrast ratio of all visible text in a frame, and it provides feedback on whether it meets WCAG’s AA and/or AAA level compliance. It also provides color sliders that allow users to adjust the colors and understand how the corresponding contrast ratio changes in real-time.


Currently only supports single, 100% solid fills. Working on some known issues with background layer detection (this is due to currently only supporting the aforementioned).


Created by Tiffany Chen

plugins.name: Breakpoints
plugins.description:
Preview responsive layout inside a Figma frame and share animated prototype.


✅ Works even without the opened plugin window and anyone in your team can resize frame without the installed plugin. For the rest, you can share an animation prototype.


► Create Responsive Layout

► Share Animated Prototype


⛔️ There are a couple of restrictions:

1. Layouts must have a filled background without transparency

2. Hug contents value for breakpoint frame is not supported


ℹ️ This is because all the breakpoint layers are in one frame, one on top of the other. And this is the only way to get such an effect in Figma.


Step 1. Add new points and snap ranges to existing layouts. You will get a live preview frame that switches when you resize.


Step 2. Enable prototype switcher and share Figma animation prototype with your team as a developer guide.


Duplicate Example File ↓


FEATURES


→ NEW: Export Figma prototype with animations

→ Works without the opened plugin window

→ Custom values with Ruler

→ Horizontal and vertical

→ Suitable for Web, Android, iOS/iPadOS

→ Quick resizing to breakpoints

→ Variants support


iOS SIZE CLASSES


If you're working on iPhone and iPad designs, the plugin can help you create dynamic layouts for Compact and Regular ranges. There is a magic point 683 for both vertical and horizontal dimensions, which ensures that anything larger is a Regular size, and anything smaller is Compact.


Duplicate Size Classes Example File ↓


TRIAL


You have a 15-day free trial for each new file with new frames. Please do not copy frames from the file where the trial period ended, this will decrease the period of the new file.


LICENSE


Pay once, use forever! To purchase a license please visit our Product Page on Gumroad.


FEEDBACK


If you have a great idea feel free to contact us by email bp-support@floweare.com. We always welcome creative suggestions from our customers.

accepted.name: Arthur
accepted.description: Working as a design director, I get a lot of insights from product designers and have the opportunity to make their life easier.

plugins.name: Zeplin
plugins.description:
Document designs. Manage workflows. Build products faster.

Building products at scale — across functions, locations, and lifecycles — is a multi-level challenge. Zeplin unites your team around your design vision, with unique workflows proven to increase production speed and quality.


Clarify design intent

  1. Separate and lock ready-to-build designs
  2. Organize in a standard way
  3. Manage design versions precisely — like Git for designs
  4. Map user flows with quick-snap connectors & templates
  5. Record requirements, design decisions, and behaviors centrally


Align your team

  1. Collaborate asynchronously in an equal, shared space
  2. Assign tasks to specific users 
  3. Secure approvals from stakeholders and prevent unapproved builds
  4. Track progress by status, assignee, or Jira/Azure DevOps ticket
  5. Search keywords on screens, components, comments & more


Translate design to code

  1. Get builds that match your design the first time
  2. Automate manual front-end tasks and visual QA
  3. Display components on every screen 
  4. Manage components and tokens in Styleguides
  5. Connect developer-first assets, code snippets, and 2-way integrations to your workflows


TO GET STARTED:

1. Install, then run the Zeplin plugin in your Figma instance

2. Sign up for free using your Figma login, Google login, or SSO

3. Create a project, invite your team, and export your first ready-to-build design! 


Resources

  1. Get Started with Figma Plugin
  2. Figma Plugin Troubleshooting Guide
  3. Design Delivery with Zeplin community file — a guided walkthrough with tips and tricks


Questions?

Have a question, suggestion, or bug to report? Ping us at support@zeplin.io.

plugins.name: Photos
plugins.description:
The most powerful plugin for populating your designs with photos


Features


  1. Search and insert photos, gifs and illustrations from various providers including Unsplash, Pixabay, Pexels, Flickr and many more
  2. Quickly insert a random set of photos
  3. Generate custom AI photos using various providers including Midjourney, Flux, Google, OpenAI and many more
  4. Edit your photos with AI: Remove background, Upscale, Expand, Erase, Area fill, Replace, Text edit and Create variations
  5. Extract photos from almost any website
  6. Inspect photos on the canvas and view details and get color palette
  7. Find similar and matching photos from your canvas or search results
  8. Save your favorite photos and user across files
  9. See which photos you have inserted and find back the original files
  10. This plugin is available for Figma, FigJam and Slides



Free vs Pro


Free version

  1. Limited features
  2. 20 AI credits


Pro version

  1. Unlimited access to all features
  2. 200 AI credits with option to purchase additional credits



Good to know


Notes

  1. Photo and user links can be found below the images
  2. The Web Assets feature can extract photos from many websites, but some sites will not work due to security reasons
  3. Some providers only provide watermarked photos, but in you can often find a matching original photo or similar photos using the image search feature


Privacy policy

  1. When using photos in your designs, please make sure to review the license information for both commercial and non-commercial use. This plugin cannot be held accountable for the wrongful usage of licenses.
  2. This plugin tracks minimal usage data to optimize features and performance. No personal data is being tracked.

plugins.name: GIF Export
plugins.description:
Ever needed to export a gif that you added to Figma? Ever wanted to export a frame with a gif in it? Here's how you can with the GIF plugin:


Export a GIF

  1. Select a frame or composition with a GIF in it
  2. Run the "Export GIF" plugin command


When exporting a gif, this plugin will use the first gif in the layer stack for the frame delay and length of the gif animation. If you want to manually define the "main" gif, just name the gif layer you want to use to "main".


Play a GIF

  1. Select a frame or composition with a GIF in it
  2. Run the "Play GIF" plugin command


Plugin creation fueled by coffee — buy me a cuppa.

plugins.name: Tokens Studio for Figma
plugins.description:
Gives you the ability to use Design Tokens that can be used for a whole range of design options, from border radii or spacer units to semantic color and typography styles that are able to reference other tokens. It allows you to change tokens and see these changes applied to the whole document, its styles or just a selection.


Generate Tokens with the UI or with your own JSON. Create or update Type, Color or Shadow Styles based on tokens. Reference tokens in each other to create type scales, container paddings or semantic colors.


Supported Tokens

  1. Colors (Fill, Border Color — hex, rgba, hsla) incl. color modifiers such as lighten, darken, mix or alpha
  2. Spacing (Horizontal, Vertical, Gap)
  3. Sizing (Width/Height)
  4. Dimension (spacing, sizing, radii, background blur)
  5. Opacity
  6. Typography (Font family, font weight, font size, line height, letter spacing, paragraph spacing)
  7. Shadow tokens (both dropShadow and innerShadow)
  8. Border tokens (color, width, strokeStyle)
  9. Border Radius (individually or each corner)
  10. Border Width
  11. Asset tokens (image fill)
  12. [Pro]: Composition tokens (think css classes for Figma)


All tokens support references to one another, so for example if you want to alias {theme.primary} to colors.blue then you'd write {colors.blue}

as a value.


Also, you can create math equations in tokens, allowing you to write a type scale like this: {fontSizeBase} * 1.618 and so on.


Find out more about Tokens Studio for Figma (Figma Tokens): tokens.studio and read the docs at docs.tokens.studio


Pro plan

To support teams that embrace this plugin we recently launched a Pro plan that comes with advanced features such as connecting tokens to Figma Styles, Multi-file sync, Advanced theme management, a branch switcher and composition tokens. If you rely on the plugin in your job, consider switching to the Pro plan to support the development of the plugin - we'll be able to ship new features faster for both the Pro and the Free version.


Usage guide

Create or update your Color or Text styles by creating tokens and then clicking Create Styles - use Styles as you were using them before.

Import existing styles to Tokens by clicking Import.

Left-click on a token to apply it to one or more layers.

Right-click a token to apply it to a specific property (such as only to Horizontal Spacing) - also you can delete or edit tokens by right-clicking them.


Example document

We've recently published an example document to play with if you're just getting started. We recommend to start the plugin in that file so you can see what you can do with the plugin.


Download free community file




Import your styles

Best way to get started is to just Import your existing styles as Tokens. Hit the "Import Styles" button on the top right.


Sync with external source of truth

  1. JSONBin
  2. URL (Read-only)
  3. GitHub
  4. GitLab
  5. Azure DevOps
  6. Supernova


This plugin is open source! Feel free to contribute, create suggestions at https://github.com/tokens-studio/figma-plugin

plugins.name: Typescales
plugins.description:
Quickly generate a simple typescale/modular scale.

This is an very early version.


# What is a modular scale?


A modular scale in Typography is used to generate a visual rhythm in font sizes. This plugin helps to generate those sizes. Starting with a base-value, font-size increments and decrements from that size with a multiplier you set.


# What can I do here?


This plugin lets you generate a modular scale. At this stage it’s fairly basic. Functions as you also could know them from websites about this topic.


1. Set a base-size

2. Set a multiplier

3. Set how many sizes you want above and below the base-size

4. Decide to round or not to round values. An addition many alternatives currently miss.

accepted.name: Marvin Bruns
accepted.description:
• Product Design
• SMARTBROKER AG

plugins.name: Fig3D
plugins.description:
Instantly convert your shapes, icons, logos and UI designs to 3D models and get a good render. All in Figma.


Features:

  • Convert shape and groups to 3D by extruding in Z - plane.
  • Render realistic images with soft-shadows from the 3D models.
  • Control view direction for the output render.
  • Adjust height and shadow direction and other light properties.
  • Switch between perspective and orthographic(isometric) projections.
  • Adjust object roughness and metalness.
  • 3D Bevel and emboss. (Corner)
  • 3D model export for external renderers.


Coming soon:

  • Saving state to continue editing later.
  • Custom 3D model import.


We are in process of adding several features and customisation options. Let me know what you think, any bugs you face or suggest features that you would like to see at palash@shaders.app

plugins.name: Google Material Design Icons by Iconduck
plugins.description:
This is an icon library of 7,687 icons and graphics, perfect for user interface and experience design. It's designed and maintained by Google, so the icons are naturally well-designed for all sorts of needs and use-cases.


Icons included in this Figma plugin are related to the following categories:

  • Action icons
  • Alert icons
  • Audio and video icons
  • Communication icons
  • Content icons
  • Device icons
  • Editor icons
  • File icons
  • Hardware icons
  • Home icons
  • Image icons and graphics
  • Map icons and vectors
  • Navigation icons
  • Notification icons
  • Place icons (like pins)
  • Search icons
  • Social icons
  • Toggle / form input icons


For more options (like downloading a ZIP of PNGs and SVG files), you can access the library here: https://iconduck.com/sets/google-material-design-icons


The icons and the library are governed by the Apache License 2.0, which makes the graphics suitable for personal and commercial projects.


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons or emojis
  • Search through them all instantly
  • Click any icon or emoji to add it your design


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite Google Material Design icons
  • View your search history
  • View your embed history
